result.execSummary:
The defendant Ariel M. Glodowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs & DNA surcharge within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Huber privileges for work, school, and any other reasons jail will allow are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Concurrent with: with 15CF56, but consecutive to 15CM65.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ariel M. Glodowski
Current: 6581 Oak Drive, Amherst, WI 54406 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2017)
Prior: 270 Shannon Court, #1, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Ariel M. Glodowski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF56, 15CF173, and 15CM65 are heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15CF173 Ct 2: 5 days jail, concurrent with 15CF56, but consecutive to 15CM65, Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
15CM65 Ct 1: 5 days jail, fine, $26.45 blood draw, 12 mo rev & IID
15CM65 Ct 3: $100 fine + costs with zero days suspension and zero days jail
15CF56 Ct 1: 5 days jail, consecutive with 15CM65. Pay costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a pleas of: 
15CM65 Ct 1: No Contest
15CM65 Ct 3: No Contest
15CF56 Ct 1:  No Contest
15CF173 Ct 2: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF173 Ct 2, 15CM65 Ct 1, 15CM65 Ct 3, & 15CF56 Ct 1:.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF56 counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 15CM65 ct 4, and 15CF173 Ct 1 are Dismissed and Read In. 15CM65 Ct 2 is Dismissed.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:****

15CM65 Ct 1: OWI 2nd: 
5 days jail, w/Huber for work and school and any other reason jail will allow. Report today to set up start date. To be served within 60 days.
$1,379.00 fine, 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
$26.45 blood draw, 
12 mo revocation of license 
12 mo IID, upon reinstatement of license

15CM65 Ct 3: OAR:
$100 fine + costs, 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
zero days suspension and zero days jail

15CF56 Ct 1: Disorderly Conduct: 
5 days jail, concurrent with 15CF173 consecutive to 15CM65. w/Huber for work and school and any other reason jail will allowReport today to set up start date. To be served within 60 days. 1 day credit
Pay costs. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan

15CF173 Ct 2: Bail Jump: 
5 days jail, concurrent with 15CF56, but consecutive to 15CM65, w/Huber for work and school and any other reason jail will allow. Report today to set up start date, 1 day jail credit. To be served within 60 days.
 Pay costs + DNA surcharge. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan (Bond to be applied).
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Ariel M. Glodowski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

3:16 pm. Court calls case.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney Mcfarland.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ariel M. Glodowski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived for preliminary 
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Cash Bond - $100 - Comply with all other outstanding bonds.

Clerk: EP
1:29 p.m. case is called
ADA Knappen  appears in Court.  
Defendant (d.o.b. 10-04-1990) appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of bail jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond $250.00  with conditions as stated.
Comply with conditions in other pending cases.
Court questions the defendant.

BTC:
Cash Bond - $100 - Comply with all other outstanding bonds.
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5-26-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Court informs she needs to contact Public Defender's office.
1:32 p.m. case is concluded.
